intro: Desmidorchis adenensis, commonly known as the Adelaide daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. Desmidorchis adenensis is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
